definition: to cause an especially slight movement or change of position of
examples: tied so tightly he could scarcely stir a finger

definition: to disturb the quiet of : agitate
examples: the bear stirred up the bees

definition: to disturb the relative position of the particles or parts of especially by a continued circular movement
examples: stirred the paint with a paddle
stirred up mud from the lake bottom

definition: to mix by or as if by stirring
bestir, exert
to bring into notice or debate : raise
to rouse to activity : evoke strong feelings in
to call forth (something, such as a memory) : evoke
provoke
to make a slight movement
to begin to move (as in rousing)
examples: She heard him stirring in bed.

definition: to shift to another location : budge
to begin to be active
to be active or busy
to pass an implement through a substance with a circular movement
examples: washed the spoon she was stirring with

definition: to be able to be stirred
examples: Add water until the mixture stirs easily.

definition: a state of disturbance, agitation, or brisk activity
widespread notice and discussion : impression
examples: the book caused quite a stir

definition: a slight movement
a stirring movement
prison
